issue.title: change linting error messages for null values in arrays

labels.name: size/XS
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 0-9 lines, ignoring generated files.

issue.body:
Closes #11627

Signed-off-by: Daniel Strobusch <1847260+dastrobu@users.noreply.github.com>

<!--  Thanks for sending a pull request!  Here are some tips for you:
1. Make sure to read the Contributing Guide before submitting your PR: https://github.com/helm/helm/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md
2. If this PR closes another issue, add 'closes #<issue number>' somewhere in the PR summary. GitHub will automatically close that issue when this PR gets merged. Alternatively, adding 'refs #<issue number>' will not close the issue, but help provide the reviewer more context.-->

**What this PR does / why we need it**:

**Special notes for your reviewer**:

**If applicable**:
- [ ] this PR contains documentation
- [x] this PR contains unit tests
- [x] this PR has been tested for backwards compatibility

body: You can see this commented by maintainer, request to change`the dependency's item can not be null` to `dependency cannot be an empty list`  https://github.com/helm/helm/pull/11044#discussion_r952537884

@wujunwei good point. 
@hickeyma can you explain your review comment? Given that an empty list (`[]`( does not fail linting, it seems confusing to me (see https://github.com/helm/helm/issues/11627#issue-1489706440).

@hickeyma sure, empty is fine as well for me. Keep in mind, though, that we cannot distinguish empty and explicit null cases: 

````yaml
dependencies:
  - name: foo
    version: 1.2.3
  # explicit null
  - null
  # empty
  - 
````
The [yaml spec](https://yaml.org/spec/1.2.2/#72-empty-nodes) refers to them as "empty nodes". So if we really care about precise error messages, I would suggest: "dependencies must not contain empty or null nodes" (PR updated accordingly).
@dastrobu Do you mind pushing the PR for this?

@hickeyma I am not sure if I understood your comment, there is an open PR #11628, which should fix this issue and addresses the comments I got on the code to the best of my knowledge. 
Can I do anything apart from waiting for a review from the maintainers?
All good @dastrobu - sorry missed the PR for some reason.
